> [krixano](#comment_748_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): Moore's law is not BS, it's an actual thing - but don't let the word "law" confuse you (It's not an actual law, it's just a statistical observation). The person who created moore's law didn't think it would even last as long as it had, which is why people, for some odd reason, think that it will continue - that computers will continue to get faster (in the way described by moore's law) - which makes absolutely no sense imo considering that we're already doing stuff at an atomical level and electricity requires electrons which are part of atoms. [...]

It's not even about computer performance - it's about doubling amount of transistors in IC. This is why Moore's law flawed. The right way to develop computer tech is to reject electronics in favor of photonics because silicon technology was already achieved its limits about 8 years ago. Transistor size in so called 7nm is almost same as in 22nm.
